intro: Galium asperifolium, commonly known as roughleaf bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium asperifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator of early succession in forest ecosystems.
